All Classes

Class Description
AI  
AIFactory
Factory class, which gives a AI object depending on the chosen AI type.
AIPanel
Panel for AI selection at the start of the game
AIType  
BoardObservable
Help class which gets data from Matrix, Mover and AI and notifies the view about it
Button
Represents a GUI button
Button.State  
CooperativeAI  
CooperativeAITest  
CoopMatrixMock  
DebugAI
Special AI class, which implements the AI interface, but is rather used to build a game or for debugging.
Directions  
DrawUtils
Help methods for drawing particular strings
GameCondition  
GameKeyListener
Listener, which gets keyboard input of the user on the GameBoard and performs the wished move
GameManager
Class with static methods, which instantiates important objects at the start of the game, connects them with the Observer pattern.
GameTurn
Static class which represents a turn in the game, consisting of a player's move (move tiles) and the spawn of a new tile from the AI
Grid
Represents the grid on which the game is played
GuiPanel
Interface for all panels
IBoardObservable
Interface for BoardObservable, which notifies the view of every single move
IBoardObserver  
IButton  
IGameBoard  
IGameConditionObservable
Interface of GameConditionObservable, which notifies the view of the current game condition (running, game won, or game lost)
IGameConditionObserver  
ILeaderboardObservable
Interface for LeaderboardObservable, which notifies the view of the current leaderboard
ILeaderboardObserver  
IMatrix  
IMover  
IScoreObservable
Interface for ScoreObservable, which notifies the view (the play panel) of the current highscore
IScoreObserver  
Leaderboards
Leaderboards class which checks, if a score can get into the highscore list.
LeaderboardsPanel
The leaderboard panel, on which the scores and tiles highscores are shown
LeaderboardsPanel.State  
LeaderboardsTest  
Main
Start point of the program
MainMenuPanel
The main menu, which appears, when the game is started
Matrix
Creates a Matrix with various sizes.
MatrixTest  
MinMaxAI
MinMax AI, which places 2s every move by calculating a Minimax-Algorithm.
MinMaxAITest  
MinMaxMulti
Another MinMaxAI with the same business logic, but using multithreading for better performance
MinMaxMultiCalc
Thread which is used by MinMaxMulti
MouseListener  
MouseMotionListener  
Mover
Moves the single Tiles in the given Direction moveTiles is the Main function.
MoverTest  
PlayPanel  
RandomAI
Creates a random AI, which places 2/4s every move Is able to create a new Tile with the value 2 or 4 at random locations
RandomAITest  
RandomMatrixMock  
RunController
Creates a thread, which refreshes the game about 60 times per second.
SaveGameManager
Provides methods to create a savegame or load a savegame
SaveGameManagerTest  
ScoreManager
Help class a observable/observer between the leaderboard and the play panel/score panel to update the current scores
Tile
Represents a single tile on the GameBoard and provides functionality for animation
ViewManager
Sets up the different parts of the view and manages updates and refreshes for all view objects (where needed).
